p: PI in Hevea and guayule contains essentially cis-1,4 units ( Figure 7), unlike the synthetic one. In fact, synthetic polyisoprene results from the polymerization of the 2-methylbuta-1,3-diene. Four polyunsaturated microstructures (1,2; 3,4; cis-1,4, trans-1,4) are formed, the most interesting configuration being cis-1,4. Even if the Ziegler-Natta catalysis allows to reached high percentage of cis-1,4 units, natural polyisoprene in NR remains irreplaceable for some applications, like plane and truck tyres [ 2].
